item.title: CSRF attack
item.author: Hato0
item.description: Cross-site request forgery Cross-site request forgery (also known as CSRF) is a web security vulnerability that allows an attacker to induce users to perform actions that they do not intend to perform. This attack can happend by phishing, clone site, etc … Conditions have to be present for this attack to be perform : A relevant action. : Change password, email, rights, … Cookie-based session handling. : Website with cookie base for sessions are an incredible candidate for this type of attack No unpredictable request parameters.
